SEARCH

Package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.hsluv

package com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure.hsluv
HSLuv, a type of Hue, Saturation, Lightness color space with more even lightness. This color space has H (hue), S (saturation, as a fraction of the maximum possible colorfulness), and L (lightness) channels. It is a new color space; HSL is much older, but HSLuv uses specific formulas to allow the most-colorful value to be mathematically calculated instead of looked up in a gamut file (as Oklab does).
HSLuv's website does a great job at describing and showing how the color space works. HSL makes a lot of sense for users to enter colors with, because there aren't any major invalid selections for channels (other than 0 or 1 L with a large S).
This package offers a SimplePalette class like the one in the ipt_hq or Oklab package, and compatible with the same descriptions (though the resulting colors will be a little different). While HSLuv and Oklab are very good at mixing colors evenly, Oklab is probably a little better at it.
  • Palette by value
  • Palette by hue
  • Palette by name
  • Related Packages
    Package
    Description
    com.github.tommyettinger.colorful.pure
    Various utility classes for handling any of the color spaces, which are in subpackages of this one.
  • Classes
    Class
    Description
    ColorTools
    Contains code for manipulating colors as int and packed float values in the HSLuv color space.
    GradientTools
    Static methods for handling gradients of smoothly-changing colors, typically inside of FloatLists.
    Palette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed HSLuv floats, the kind ColorTools works with.
    SimplePalette
    A palette of predefined colors as packed HSLuv floats, the kind ColorTools works with, plus a way to describe colors by combinations and adjustments.
